title: Fill In The Blanks | General Grammar Exercise

questions.question: Tell me if you ……………………….. any help.
questions.description: The simple present is used in situations like these.

questions.question: The first time I ………………………… him was at university.
questions.description: The simple past is used to say when something happened.

questions.question: This is the garage ……………………….. they used to work.
I ……………………………. a terrible experience yesterday.
questions.description: Had is the past simple form of have.

questions.question: That is my biggest regret …………………………
questions.description: Yet shows time up to now.

questions.question: The valley ………………………….. quiet and beautiful in the morning.
questions.description: Lay is the past simple form of lie.

questions.question: Each of us ……………………………. the world differently.
questions.description: Use a singular verb after each.

questions.question: …………………………… his illness, he could not write the exam.
questions.description: Owing to and due to both mean because of.

questions.question: The summer term ………………………… on April 12th.
questions.description: The simple present is more appropriate here. It is used to talk about predetermined actions that are part of a time table.

questions.question: I will pay you back when I ………………………… a job.
questions.description: When both clauses refer to the future, a simple present is used after when.

questions.question: I promise I …………………………… in the evening.
questions.description: Simple future is used to express this idea.

questions.question: I stayed in bed all day ……………………………. going to work.
